data.title: Flavorless and small
data.text: Ordered a "tamale and burrito combo plate". The tamale was bigger than the burrito. The tamale was flat. The beans had no cheese and were not retried. The rice and the tamale had no flavor. Will not repeat as a lunch place.

data.title: Don't Eat Outside On The Patio
data.text:
I have frequented this restaurant for several years, it has often been a favorite with great food and prices.  However, I do NOT recommend eating outdoors.  After a recent trip to the restaurant, my friend and I both got eaten alive by mosquitoes.  I am not kidding you when I say that we EACH have 10-12 mosquito bites on our feet/ankles/legs.

Yes, I know that it's the summer and it's mosquito season, but if you're an established restaurant who attracts many customers due to the ability to enjoy dining outdoors, you need to invest in spraying your property for bugs/mosquitoes!!  This is ridiculous!!  Take some responsibility or atleast warn your guests that the mosquitoes have been bad and may want to consider eating in doors.  Had I known this, we would have enjoyed our meal inside the restaurant.

I have been miserable and uncomfortable for days now since our visit to El Meson.  All that said, it was definitely not worth the food or money.  My advice to anyone considering dining at this restaurant, DO NOT eat on their patio unless they can confirm and assure you that they have professionally sprayed and are managing their bug issue.  Unbelievable.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: But wayyyyy overpriced. Wait staff is nice but slow. The service is slow, so you'll but more drinks. Food is really excellent for Mexican food. I don't think it's really worth the price and the wait.

data.title: Authentic and delicious !!
data.text: Best Mexican food in the northwest suburbs. Friendly informative staff eager to enhance your dining experience.  We visit about 4 times a year.  Enchiladas are my personal favorite.

data.title: Disappointing!
data.text: Had heard from friends this was very good, but was completely disappointed! Food was luke warm when it got to our table and the server was not very attentive to the tables, too bust talking to busboys.

data.title: Fabulous margaritas
data.text: Love to sit outside and dine alfresco    great food and  the staff is so helpful with suggestions if you are not able to pick just one item.

data.title: Lamb Tacos!
data.text: El Meson has very good authentic Mexican food as well as Americanized Mexican fare.  On weekends they offer lamb tacos that are excellent.  Get them with the sauce and torilla's on the side/make your own.  You will not be disappointed if you are a lamb fan.  The fajitas are good and enchilada's are great as well.  Finally, you must try their killer margaritas.

data.title: Lunch/dinner
data.text:
Food is good, good portions, decent prices. Family place. 
We use to frequent but scaling back on this one. Not thrilled with the service. 
Service is slow, they always seem short staffed and short tempered, don't expect service w a smile. 
And we are not complainers but a few times I came close. 
We like the fact we can sit outside on good weather days. And I think weekends they have live music mariachis. 
Hit or miss!!

data.title: Great food.
data.text: I went to the lunch buffet, great food and environment was pleasing.  Out door seating was awesome....

data.title: Great outdoor seating!
data.text: Excellent ceviche and authentic Mexican.  Service always friendly.  Great for a summer evening or any time of year!  I like the Enchiladas and guacamole made fresh as well.  Eat here for an off the beaten path non-chain local experience.

data.title: Mexican, Mexican!
data.text: This was a very enjoyable Mexican dinner.  It tasted more like the food we had in upscale hotels in Acapulco than many of the other Mexican restaurants  we have frequented in our area.  The decorations in the restaurant are simple and non-ostentatious.and the service has always been friendly and good.  Patrons can choose to eat on the small patio or in the restaurant itself. We have never seen any mariachis there which we see as a plus.  This is just a good place to eat Mexican food.

data.title: Good price , ok food.
data.text: The food is good, not authentic Mexican by any means, but tasty. The prices are reasonable. It is worth a trip.

data.title: Go for lunch!
data.text:
Dinner entrees for this place are on the pricey side. However, El Meson has a very reasonable and varied lunch menu. Love the cheese enchiladas, my husband likes the soft shell tacos. Chips are nothing special; two salsas are served--gringo red and a tasty verde. 

One thing that I do find irritating is that beverages are listed on the menu without a price.

Because we weren't in a hurry, service wasn't an issue. We were supplied with chips/salsas and our beverages pronto.

data.title: Sunday buffets are good
data.text:
We have been going here quite a few years.  Sunday buffets we enjoy.  There are many home made items and the
staff is friendly.

data.title: dinner with friends
data.text:
One of the best Hispanic restaurants I've dined in north of the Rio Grande,  food has always been served hot and quickly.  A large assortment of meals, all prepared and presented well.  A large selection of drinks available to quench your thirst.

During summer and early fall, sit on the patio, its fantastic!

data.title: Sunday Brunch is great!
data.text: If you are looking for a compination of Mexican, Eggs and Waffles. This is the place! Cost is a little more than Lalos, but if you have someone in your party who doesn't like or is just wanting something different you might be satisfied.

data.title: Best outdoor seating in town
data.text:
Great food, great atmosphere, wonderful cocktails, all close to home.. What more could a girl ask for?! 
Now if only we had warm weather more often.. lol

data.title: Pretty good grub
data.text:
Went here with a large group and had a good time.  They were Johnny on the spot with chips n salsa and refills.  The red salsa is the one with heat and green is mild.

I ordered the tamales with pork, it was really good and one of the house specialties.  Other people got the steak and chicken tacos and they enjoyed them.

The drinks are very reasonable also FYI!

data.title: Will Not Return
data.text: I moved from the city to the suburbs expecting to find good AUTHENTIC Mexican food and was disappoined. I was surprised to have such Americanized Mexican food after eating at their location in Cicero where the food and service were actually good.

data.title: Open or not??
data.text: we've gone there a couple of times during their supposedly business times, but they were not open.. even though there was an 'open' sign on the window by the door.. so if you're not open can you pls state that for future.. saw no one in the restaurant and no cars in the lot. this was 11/29/15 after 11 a.m.
